page.title: 08THE EFFECT OF BROUGH BYPASS
page.content:
THE BYPASS HAS SPLIT BROUGH AND CHURCH BROUGH IN HALF.IT WAS BUILT NINE YEARS AGO.IT MAKES A GREAT DIFFERENCE.
BEFORE IT WAS BUILT THERE USED TO BE TRAFFIC GALORE.THE SHOPS MADE GOOD TRADE BUT SOMETIMES RAN OUT OF STOCK. THE PETROL GARAGE WAS BUSY AS WELL AND WAITERS WERE RUSHED OFF THEIR FEET IN THE CAFES AND NEVER ENOUGH SEATS TO SIT DOWN.
NOW EVERYTHING HAS CHANGED. THE SHOPS ARE QUIET AND ALWAYS HAVE ENOUGH FOOD AND THE CAFES ARE EMPTY AND ALSO ONE PETROL STATION HAS CLOSED DOWN.
NOW YOU CAN TURN A CAR ROUND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE ROAD. BUT IF THE BYPASS HADN'T BEEN BUILT A LOT OF PEOPLE WOULD NOT HAVE GOT ROAD BUILDING JOBS.
